title: Enterprise, Trade and Employment (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order
heading: I, NEALE RICHMOND, Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise,
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 1) REGULATIONS 2023 

I, NEALE RICHMOND, Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, 
Trade and Employment, in exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 
3 and 19(3) of the National Minimum Wage Act 2000 (No. 5 of 2000) and the 
Enterprise, Trade and Employment (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 
2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), and having consulted with such representatives of 
employers and employees in the State as I consider appropriate, hereby make 
the following regulations:
text_norm: schedule 1) regulation 2023 neale richmond minister state department enterprise trade employment exercise power conferred section 3 19(3) national minimum wage act 2000 (no 5 2000) enterprise trade employment (delegation ministerial functions) order 2023 (s.i no 14 2023) consulted representative employer employee state consider appropriate hereby make following regulation

title: Enterprise, Trade and Employment (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the National Minimum Wage Act
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the National Minimum Wage Act 

2000 (Amendment of Schedule 1) Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited national minimum wage act 2000 (amendment schedule 1) regulation 2023

title: Enterprise, Trade and Employment (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order
heading: 2. Schedule 1 to the National Minimum Wage Act 2000 (No. 5 of 2000) is
text_raw:
2. Schedule 1 to the National Minimum Wage Act 2000 (No. 5 of 2000) is 

amended – 

(a) 

in Part 1, by the substitution of the following paragraph for 
paragraph 5: 

“5. 
The amount of any service charge distributed to the 
employee through the payroll (excluding any charge distributed 
by the employer to which section 4D(1) of the Payment of 
Wages Act 1991 applies).”, 

and 

(b) 

in Part 2, by the substitution of the following paragraph for 
paragraph 5: 

“5. 

Any amount of — 

(a) 

a tip or gratuity (within the meaning of section 1 
of the Payment of Wages Act 1991) paid into a 
central fund managed by the employer and 
distributed to the employee through the payroll, 
or 

(b) 

a charge distributed by the employer (to which 
section 4D(1) of that Act applies).”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 24 May 2023 

NEALE RICHMOND, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, Trade and 

Employment. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 30th May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [260] 3

title: Enterprise, Trade and Employment (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

The purpose of these Regulations is to re-classify service charges as a nonreckonable component in the calculation of the average hourly rate of pay. This 
re-classification will only apply to the sectors in the economy to whom the 
Payment of Wages (Amendment) (Tips and Gratuities) Act 2022 applies. This 
will have the effect of ensuring that service charges are not used by employers 
in those sectors when calculating an employee’s hourly rate of pay for the 
purposes of the National Minimum Wage Act 2000. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [260]
